text: Describe some strategies for recognizing equivalent representations?
Students may begin by finding general sorts and then refine them. General sorts may include:

• increasing linear, decreasing linear, and non-linear.
  • proportional or non-proportional

• determine the y-intercepts and rates of change. Then use those to find the equivalent representation.
  • use one representation to find another. For example, they may put the equations into a graphing calculator to get the graph and table.
  • find the ratio of the rise to the run for the representation. Then, find other representations with the same ratio.
  • Use the properties of equality to find equivalent equations.
  • Look for values that match, for example find an x and y value on the table that is the coordinate pair of a point on the graph. Substitute the values into the equation(s) to see if the equation is true for those values.
